decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressive plays with low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion allows for additional mana fixing and flexibility in the deck. Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger provide early pressure, while spells like Titan's Strength and Monstrous Rage boost their power. The deck also includes some removal options like Fatal Push and Reckless Rage to deal with opponent threats. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with quick and efficient damage output.

The deck focuses on utilizing Enigmatic Incarnation to control the board and search for powerful creatures to outvalue the opponent. The deck includes a variety of Overlord creatures with complementary abilities, along with support cards like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse for removal. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value from flickering creatures and enchantments. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize the effectiveness of Enigmatic Incarnation. Ultimately, the deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and generate incremental advantage to secure victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a combination of efficient removal spells, powerful creatures, and disruption. The key strategy is to quickly establish a board presence with aggressive creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Bloodtithe Harvester, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck also utilizes land cards like Mutavault and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to provide extra value and flexibility in combat. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and force the opponent to react defensively.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying Arclight Phoenixes from the graveyard with spells like Opt, Fiery Impulse, and Lightning Axe, while also utilizing Treasure Cruise to draw into more resources. Artist's Talent and Picklock Prankster provide additional value and card advantage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Spell Pierce to protect its game plan. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, with a splash of red and blue cards to support the aggressive strategy. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its fast-paced and synergistic gameplay.

This deck focuses on a fast and aggressive strategy with a mix of creatures, removal spells, and disruption tools. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Unstoppable Slasher, along with powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control of the board. Cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Thoughtseize help to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Mutavault and Blightstep Pathway ensure consistent mana development for the aggressive threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through removal spells and enchantments, while also utilizing creatures with powerful abilities to maintain board presence and outvalue the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the multicolor nature of the deck, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and activating abilities. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and establish dominance through card advantage and efficient removal, ultimately leading to victory through incremental advantage and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly deploy low-cost creatures and pump them up with various combat tricks and abilities to deal fast and efficient damage to the opponent. The deck focuses on utilizing cheap creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Burning-Tree Emissary to apply early pressure, while also using cards like Monstrous Rage and Kumano Faces Kakkazan to further enhance their power. With a mix of direct damage spells and powerful creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly casting spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard, overwhelming the opponent with aggressive plays. It also utilizes cards that dig through the deck for more spells, along with additional card draw to maintain resources. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells and counter magic, while consistently bringing back Arclight Phoenix to apply pressure. Additionally, it includes extra turn effects to further capitalize on the spell-heavy gameplay and gain a tempo advantage over the opponent.
